<< How would you all feel if I kept on talking about where Pluto was this
week,
what aspects it's going to be making to Mars. Which house is having the

not living a harmonious life with the Universe? >>


I would be very interested.

NICKI~

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1473
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/15/01 10:46:00 AM Mountain Daylight Time, ... United Methodists are a combination of Methodists and Evangelical United Brethren (a
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/15/01 10:46:00 AM Mountain Daylight Time,
marbleface@... writes:


> I believe GWB is a member of the United Methodist Church. Evangelism is a
> part of the church doctrine. So this may all seem fine and dandy to him.
>

United Methodists are a combination of Methodists and Evangelical United
Brethren (a denomination that was subsumed into United Methodists in the late
1960's, I think--they were called "EUB's" but theyr'e not around anymore).


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

It's a bit over the top for some of us.

Nance

>_______________________________________________________________________

>Message: 12

> From: SandraDodd@...
>Subject: Re: Religion
>
>>
>There hasn't yet been a president who wasn't Christian. It's not required,
>but it's not forbidden.
>
>The church can't make binding policies (and which church would that be? We
>don't have one dominant Christian denomination, although I heard once most
>Presidents have been Episcopalian or Presbyterian, but I don't know that
>for
>sure. I think Carter and Clinton have been the only Baptists. I don't
>think
>LBJ was Baptist. (I could be wrong). Kennedy has been the only Catholic
>president.
>
>What was Ford?
>
>Sandra
